ncsd_python¶

There are two top-level modules here and two sub-modules.

ncsd_multi.py¶

A module to facilitate running ncsd with many nuclei

  • takes sets of inputs for multiple ncsd runs. Then, for each run:

    • makes a folder so each run’s output is contained, copies .exe file

    • makes a bunch of mfdp.dat files to complete each run

    • runs each process at the end, if desired.

output_exporter.py¶

A module for helping to deal with data from NCSD output files, and export that data to different formats (e.g. png plots, xmgrace files).

You can run this file by adjusting some parameters within it first, or by just running python output_exporter.py -f filename, if you’re okay with default values.

ncsd_python.output_exporter.make_plot_files(output_paths=[], save_dir=None, out_types=['xmgrace'], skip_Nmax=[], max_state=1e+100, get_online_data=False)¶

This takes ncsd output filenames, and exports the data to each format listed in out_types.

skip_Nmax = list of Nmax values to skip

max_state = maximum numbered state to consider
